HARTA voturilor din străinătate |work=Gândul |author=Sorina Ionașc |date=20 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} || ''10.26%'' || {{yes|''89.73%''}} |} *'''Source''': [http://www.hotnews.ro/stiri-politic-18585339-harta-interactiva-rezultatele-finale-ale-alegerilor-prezidentiale-turul-fiecare-judet-din-tara.htm HotNews.ro] ===Confirmation of results=== On 21 November 2014, the [[Constitutional Court of Romania|Constitutional Court]] confirmed the results of the election and validated the election of [[Klaus Iohannis]] as [[President of Romania]].http://www.ccr.ro/files/products/hotararea_621.pdfhttp://www.ccr.ro/files/products/Hotararea_631.pdf == Reactions == === Protests === [[File:Vot și proteste la München 2 noiembrie 2014 Dan Mihai Pitea (4).JPG|thumb|200px|First round. Voters protesting in front of the General Consulate of [[Munich]], just minutes after the polls closed.]] Several protests broke out in many cities abroad with large communities of Romanians. In [[Paris]], [[London]], [[Chișinău]], [[Munich]], [[Stuttgart]], [[Vienna]], [[Turin]] and other cities, Romanians expressed their dissatisfaction concerning the hindering of the voting process and closure before 9 p.m. of the polling stations.{{cite web |url=http://www.mediafax.ro/politic/votul-in-diaspora-cozi-uriase-stampile-putine-proteste-porti-inchise-inainte-de-21-00-13486181 |title=Votul în diaspora: cozi uriașe, ștampile puține, proteste, porți închise înainte de 21:00 |work=Mediafax.ro |author=Cătălina Mihai |date=3 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} Protesters demanded the resignation of Foreign Minister [[Titus Corlățean]] and booed the Romanian Government led by PSD candidate [[Victor Ponta]]. In [[Paris]], the Romanian Embassy was assaulted by angry protesters. However, the situation defused after the intervention of special forces. [[File:Alegerile prezidențiale românești din 16 noiembrie 2014 la München (2).webm|thumb|left|Second round. A video depicting potential voters waiting and protesting in [[Munich]], approximately one hour before the polls closed on 16 November]] Protests in solidarity with [[Romanian diaspora]] also took place in major Romanian cities.{{cite web |url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2014/11/14/us-romania-election-protests-idUSKCN0IY29920141114 |title=Thousands protest in Romania ahead of presidential run-off vote |work=Reuters |author=Luiza Ilie |date=14 November 2014}}{{cite web |url= http://www.euronews.com/2014/11/15/romania-sees-protests-ahead-of-elections/ |title=Romania sees protests ahead of elections |work=Euronews |date=15 November 2014}} Organized on [[Facebook]], the protests attracted between 10,000 and 15,000 people in [[Cluj-Napoca]], 5,000 in [[Timișoara]], 4,000 in [[Bucharest]],{{cite web |url=http://adevarul.ro/news/bucuresti/bucurestenii-ies-nou-strada-s-au-plimbat-sediul-psd-4000-oameni-avem-arma-mai-puternica-decat-loc-democratia-1_5466fffd0d133766a8e247db/index.html |title=Bucureștenii ies din nou în stradă, după ce ieri s-au plimbat până la sediul PSD peste 4.000 de oameni. "Avem o armă mai puternică decât voi toți la un loc: democrația" |work=Adevărul |author=Cristina Răduță |date=15 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} 2,000 in [[Craiova]] and [[Sibiu]], 1,000 in [[Arad, Romania|Arad]].{{cite web |url=http://www.gandul.info/stiri/zeci-de-mii-de-romani-au-iesit-in-strada-pentru-un-vot-corect-in-turul-doi-harta-protestelor-din-marile-orase-gandul-a-transmis-live-13550819 |title=Zeci de mii de români au ieșit în stradă pentru un vot corect în turul doi. HARTA PROTESTELOR din marile orașe. GÂNDUL A TRANSMIS LIVE |work=Gândul |author=Andrei Luca Popescu, Adriana Stanca |date=14 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} Many of the protesters were students, young people, intellectuals and people with higher education. They demanded fair elections and Victor Ponta's resignation as PM, whose image was associated with cartoon figures like [[Mickey Mouse]] and [[Pinocchio]]. [[Counter-protest]]s organized by sympathizers of PSD also took place in [[Galați]], [[Alba Iulia]], [[Bistrița]], [[Bacău]], [[Craiova]] and [[Brașov]], but were attended by fewer people.{{cite web |url=http://www.hotnews.ro/stiri-politic-18557239-livetext-mitinguri-solidaritate-romanii-din-strainatate-anuntate-mai-multe-orase-mari-din-tara.htm |title=Mitinguri masive în toată țara împotriva lui Ponta / În Cluj s-au adunat circa 10.000 de oameni / Câteva mii de protestatari din București au scandat la sediul PSD - Ieși afară, javră ordinară / Ponta, nu reziști nici cu mii de securiști! / Ponta, ce-a pățit procurorul Panait? |work=HotNews.ro |date=14 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} During a campaign visit at Millenium Hall, [[Baia Mare]], on 6 November, Victor Ponta was booed by hundreds of people protesting against his disinformation and manipulation uttered at his rival, [[Klaus Iohannis]], and condemning the statements in previous days of the premier and ministers [[Liviu Dragnea]], [[Titus Corlățean]] and Bogdan Stanoevici regarding the unfolding of voting process in diaspora.{{cite web |url=http://www.cotidianul.ro/victor-ponta-scos-cu-duba-ca-sa-fie-ferit-de-un-grup-de-protestatari-250701/ |title=Victor Ponta, scos cu duba ca să fie ferit de un grup de protestatari |work=Cotidianul.ro |author=Lucian Gheorghiu |date=6 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} In order to avoid any incidents, Prime Minister Victor Ponta was evacuated from the building by SPP agents and local policemen using a van-minibus.{{cite web |url=http://www.ziare.com/victor-ponta/candidat-alegeri-prezidentiale-2014/ponta-huiduit-si-scos-cu-duba-din-multime-video-1331875 |title=Ponta, huiduit și scos cu duba din mulțime |work=Ziare.com |date=7 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} Victor Ponta accused rival party ACL of organizing the protests, but ACL belied these accusations. Moreover, leaders of ACL and candidate [[Klaus Iohannis]] saluted "the civic spirit of all Romanians who in recent days have protested (...) against candidate Victor Ponta's attempt to manipulate the Romanians vote".{{cite web |url=http://www.gandul.info/politica/predoiu-ii-acuza-pe-ponta-si-corlatean-de-complot-acl-nu-a-fost-implicata-in-proteste-13517980 |title=Predoiu îi acuză pe Ponta și Corlățean de complot. "ACL nu a fost implicată în proteste" |work=Gândul |author=Andi Manciu |date=9 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} Poor organization of the second round in diaspora, but also violent dispersal of Romanian voters after the polls closed angered people in Romania that gathered in their tens of thousands in the largest protest against Ponta's government since the [[2013 Romanian protests against the Roșia Montană Project|demonstrations against the Roșia Montană Project in the autumn of 2013]]. === Post-election === {{Quote box |quote = Dear Romanians, all of you have been heroes today. |author = [[Klaus Iohannis]], after the publication of first exit-pollshttp://www.mediafax.ro/politic/iohannis-dragi-romani-ati-fost-niste-eroi-votul-a-decurs-fenomenal-o-prezenta-enorma-nu-mi-e-teama-va-multumesc-tuturor-13571563 |align = right}} The final result was widely seen as a surprise, as all polls before the second round showed Ponta as a clear favorite over Iohannis.{{cite web|url=http://www.ft.com/intl/cms/s/0/4ddc6ae6-6ddb-11e4-8f96-00144feabdc0.html#axzz3JKD3cDYw|title=Iohannis wins Romanian election - FT.com|work=Financial Times}}http://www.nytimes.com/2014/11/17/world/europe/favorite-concedes-presidency-in-romania.html{{cite web|url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/11234915/Romanian-presidential-election-victory-for-centre-right-candidate-Klaus-Iohannis.html|title=Romanian presidential election victory for centre-right candidate Klaus Iohannis|date=16 November 2014|work=Telegraph.co.uk}}{{cite web|url=http://news.yahoo.com/romanian-pm-concedes-surprise-defeat-presidential-vote-231818750.html|title=Surprise presidential victory for Romania's Iohannis|date=17 November 2014|work=Yahoo News}}{{cite web|url=http://www.novinite.com/articles/164797/Klaus+Iohannis+Wins+Romania+Presidential+Vote|title=Klaus Iohannis Wins Romania Presidential Vote|publisher=}} Ponta did not give a speech at 9 p.m. when the polling ended, and a few hours later he conceded defeat, declaring that "the people are always right" and congratulating Klaus Iohannis over the phone.{{cite web|url=http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/victor-ponta-loses-to-klaus-iohannis-in-romanias-presidential-runoff-9864057.html|title=Victor Ponta loses to Klaus Iohannis in Romania’s presidential run-off|work=The Independent}} Cristian Ghinea of the Romanian Center for European Policies considered that "Iohannis did a poor job in the two debates, but Ponta mobilized the people against himself (...) He ran a dirty campaign which blew up in his face", while Sergiu Miscoiu, an analyst, thought that "a major mistake was ostracizing the diaspora". Ponta ruled out quitting as prime minister until the parliamentary elections in 2016. Only about 10% of diaspora ended up voting for Ponta.http://www.realitatea.net/klaus-iohannis-castigator-klaus-iohannis-noul-presedinte-romania_1571834.html Upon closing of the polls in Romania, Klaus Iohannis thanked voters for the high turnout and asked the Government to extend the voting period in diaspora to allow everyone in line to vote. Later in the evening, when the victory became clear, he went to [[University Square, Bucharest|University Square]], [[Bucharest]], where up to 20,000 people were celebrating, and declared that "we took our country back".{{cite web|url=http://stirileprotv.ro/stiri/alegeri-prezidentiale-2014/primele-declaratii-ale-lui-klaus-iohannis-dupa-exit-poll-uri-dragi-romani-ati-fost-niste-eroi.html|title=Klaus Iohannis a fost in Piata Universitatii si le-a multumit oamenilor: "Am castigat! Ne-am luat tara inapoi"|work=stirileprotv.ro}} On Monday morning Iohannis declared that he will be a free president that will represent all Romanians.{{cite web|url=http://www.mediafax.ro/politic/iohannis-prima-declaratie-oficiala-dragi-romani-va-multumesc-voi-fi-un-presedinte-liber-va-voi-reprezenta-pe-voi-solicitarile-lui-iohannis-13576745|title=Iohannis, prima declaraţie oficială: Dragi români, vă mulţumesc. Voi fi un preşedinte liber, vă voi reprezenta pe voi. SOLICITĂRILE lui Iohannis|work=Mediafax.ro}}{{cite web|url=http://www.evz.ro/klaus-iohannis-dragi-romani-va-multumesc.html|title=Klaus Iohannis, prima declaraţie oficială: "Dragi români, vă mulțumesc. Acum trebuie să ne apucăm de treabă"|publisher=}} Following the elections, a wave of resignations occurred in the PSD.{{cite web | url=http://www.hotnews.ro/stiri-politic-18586938-prima-demisie-din-psd-dupa-alegeri-gabriel-zetea-presedintele-psd-maramures-plecat-din-partid.htm | title=Prima demisie dupa alegeri: Gabriel Zetea, presedintele PSD Maramures, a demisionat | accessdate=20 November 2014}}{{cite web | url=http://www.evz.ro/demisii-in-psd-constanta-dupa-rezultatul-dezastruos-al-alegerilor-prezidentiale-radu-mazare-se-mai-gandeste.html | title=Demisii în PSD Constanţa după rezultatul "dezastruos" al alegerilor prezidenţiale. Radu Mazăre se mai gândeşte | accessdate=20 November 2014}}{{cite web | url=http://www.realitatea.net/demisii-pe-banda-in-psd-dupa-votul-din-diaspora_1573896.html | title=DEMISII pe bandă în PSD, după votul din Diaspora | accessdate=20 November 2014}} Foreign Minister Teodor Meleșcanu also resigned following the diaspora voting fiasco, thus setting a record for the shortest term as minister in Romania's post-Communist history, having served for only eight days.{{cite web | url=http://stirileprotv.ro/stiri/politic/ministrul-de-externe-teodor-melescanu-sustine-o-conferinta-de-presa-live-ora-10-30.html | title=Ministrul Afacerilor Externe, Teodor Melescanu, si-a dat marti demisia si a stabilit un record national: a fost ministrul plin cu cel mai scurt mandat din istoria post decembrista, adica 8 zile | accessdate=20 November 2014}} PSD senator Mircea Geoană, who ran unsuccessfully against Traian Băsescu in the [[Romanian presidential election, 2009|2009 presidential elections]], characterized the result as a "dramatic moment for the Romanian Left" and warned that the PSD needs to "reinvent itself".{{cite web | url=http://vreaupresedinte.gandul.info/news/avertismentul-lui-geoana-situatia-psd-mai-grava-decat-in-2004-votul-negativ-a-fost-de-o-intensitate-fara-precedent-13580966?utm_source=www.zf.ro&utm_medium=Banda_teasing_articol&utm_campaign=Vreaupresedinte | title=Avertismentul lui Geoană: Situaţia PSD, mai gravă decât în 2004; votul negativ a fost de o intensitate fără precedent | accessdate=20 November 2014}} President-elect Iohannis stated that he want to topple the government.{{cite web |url=http://www.repubblica.it/esteri/2014/12/03/news/iohannis_sfida_putin_la_mia_romania_vuole_un_europa_forte-102003307/?ref=search |title=Iohannis: "La mia Romania vuole un'Europa forte" |work=La Repubblica |author=Andrea Tarquini |language=Italian |date=3 December 2014}} In this regard, PNL leaders intend to file a [[motion of censure]] at the beginning of 2015. ==== International ==== * {{flagicon|United States}} [[U.S. Government]] congratulated President-elect Klaus Iohannis for his appointment, but also "Romanians, who went to the polls in large numbers, both in country and abroad, in an exemplary demonstration of civic participation".{{cite web |url=http://www.mediafax.ro/politic/guvernul-sua-il-felicita-pe-klaus-iohannis-pentru-alegerea-ca-presedinte-13611967 |title=Guvernul SUA îl felicită pe Klaus Iohannis pentru alegerea ca președinte |work=Mediafax.ro |date=21 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} * {{flagicon|EU}} [[Joseph Daul]], President of the [[European People's Party]], congratulated Klaus Johannis for the victory in the presidential election, specifying it is "an excellent news" for Romania and the [[European Union]]. He stated that Iohannis "will maintain Romania on the democratic way and will lead it in the interest of the Romanian people". On the other hand, Daul expressed disappointment with the "bad conditions" of voting in diaspora.{{cite web |url=http://www.mediafax.ro/politic/joseph-daul-victoria-lui-klaus-iohannis-o-veste-excelenta-pentru-romania-si-pentru-ue-13578519 |title=Joseph Daul: Victoria lui Klaus Iohannis - o veste excelentă pentru România și pentru UE |work=Mediafax.ro |author=Cătălina Mihai |date=17 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} Likewise, the [[European Commission President]] [[Jean-Claude Juncker]] has sent to President-elect of Romania, Klaus Iohannis, a congratulatory letter expressing eagerness to work with the new head of state and government of the country for implementation of the EU agenda, focusing on jobs, investment, competitiveness and growth.{{cite web |url=http://www.hotnews.ro/stiri-esential-18627514-presedintele-felicita-iohannis-abia-astept-lucrez-dumneavoastra-guvernul-implementarea-agendei-strategice-pentru.htm |title=Președintele CE îl felicită pe Iohannis: De-abia aștept să lucrez cu dumneavoastră și cu Guvernul la implementarea agendei strategice pentru UE |work=HotNews.ro |author=Claudiu Zamfir |date=21 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} * {{flagicon|UK}} [[British PM]] [[David Cameron]] also sent Iohannis a congratulatory letter. In reply, Iohannis thanked for it and assured Cameron of strengthening the bilateral relations between the two countries.{{cite web |url=http://www.digi24.ro/Stiri/Digi24/Actualitate/Politica/Klaus+Iohannis+il+asigura+pe+Cameron+de+intregul+sau+sprijin+pen |title=Klaus Iohannis îl asigură pe David Cameron de întregul său sprijin pentru întărirea relațiilor bilaterale |work=Digi24 |date=4 December 2014 |language=Romanian}} * {{flagicon|Germany}} [[German President]] [[Joachim Gauck]] congratulated Klaus Iohannis for victory in the presidential election and assured that [[Germany]] would continue to support Romania on track of important reforms, particularly in terms of strengthening the rule of law.{{cite web |url=http://www.mediafax.ro/externe/presedintele-si-cancelarul-germaniei-l-au-felicitat-pe-iohannis-gauck-vom-sprijini-romania-in-consolidarea-statului-de-drept-merkel-vom-aprofunda-relatiile-bilaterale-13587083 |title=Președintele și cancelarul Germaniei l-au felicitat pe Iohannis. Gauck: Vom sprijini România în consolidarea statului de drept. Merkel: Vom aprofunda relațiile bilaterale |work=Mediafax.ro |author=Cătălina Mihai |date=18 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} Chancellor [[Angela Merkel]] also congratulated Iohannis, stressing that together will deepen bilateral relations. * {{flagicon|France}} "I am pleased to address my sincere congratulations and my wishes of success in fulfilling your high mission", said [[French President]] [[François Hollande]] in a letter sent to Klaus Iohannis. The letter also shows: "Together with you, I want to build a more prosperous, fairer and stronger, able Europe, at times when faces various crises in its neighborhood, to spread its characteristic values, namely democracy and respect for the rule of law".{{cite web |url=http://www.digi24.ro/Stiri/Digi24/Special/COTROCENI+2014/Francois+Hollande+l-a+felicitat+pe+Klaus+Iohannis+pentru+castiga |title=F. Hollande l-a felicitat pe K. Iohannis: Îmi face plăcere să vă invit la Paris, în funcție de agenda dumneavoastră |work=Digi24 |date=19 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} * {{flagicon|Russia}} Spokesman for the Russian Foreign Ministry, Alexander Lukashevich, expressed Moscow's position on the presidential election, expressing the hope that, after the election of Klaus Iohannis, the two countries will register a "major change" in their relations after the break caused by "Bucharest's criticism over Moscow's policies" concerning the [[2014 pro-Russian unrest in Ukraine|Ukrainian conflict]], but also other international issues.{{cite web |url=http://www.gandul.info/international/primul-mesaj-al-rusiei-dupa-castigarea-alegerilor-de-catre-klaus-iohannis-13606588 |title=Primul mesaj al Rusiei după câștigarea alegerilor de către Klaus Iohannis |work=Gândul |author=Mihaela Stoica |date=20 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} * {{flagicon|Hungary}} [[President of Hungary]], [[János Áder]], conveyed his congratulations to Iohannis for victory in the presidential scrutiny. In a letter sent to Iohannis, János Áder requested a meeting between the two leaders to discuss issues of mutual interest and to analyze the directions of bilateral cooperation.{{cite web |url=http://www.mediafax.ro/externe/presedintele-ungariei-janos-ader-l-a-felicitat-pe-klaus-iohannis-13591277 |title=Președintele Ungariei, Janos Ader, l-a felicitat pe Klaus Iohannis |work=Mediafax.ro |author=Mihai Drăghici |date=18 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} == Gallery == File:Victor Ponta la dezbaterea de la Antena 3 - 13.11 (1) (15805103741).jpg|Victor Ponta and [[Italian Prime Minister]] [[Matteo Renzi]] at a debate on [[Antena 3 (Romania)|Antena 3]], 13 November. Klaus Iohannis did not attend the debate. File:Victor Ponta la dezbatere Realitatea TV - 11.11 (1) (15153345483).jpg|Klaus Iohannis and Victor Ponta at a debate on [[Realitatea TV]], moderated by Rareș Bogdan ''(center)'' File:Depunerea candidaturii lui Victor Ponta pentru alegerile prezidentiale 2014 - 17.09 (17) (15082648897).jpg|Submission of Victor Ponta's candidacy for presidential election at the Central Electoral Bureau File:Lansarea candidaturii lui Victor Ponta la alegerile prezidentiale din 2014 - 20.09 (3) (15202870090).jpg|Victor Ponta launching his candidacy on [[Arena Națională|National Arena]], in the presence of his wife [[Daciana Sârbu]] ''(right)'' and 70,000 other people == Controversies == The candidate of Christian Liberal Alliance, [[Klaus Iohannis]], publicly asked Prime Minister [[Victor Ponta]] for the cancellation of Ordinance 45 of 2014, that amends the legislation on presidential elections,{{cite web |url=http://www.b1.ro/stiri/politica/klaus-iohannis-ii-cere-premierului-victor-ponta-amanarea-alegerilor-preziden-iale-din-toamna-88954.html |title=Klaus Iohannis îi cere premierului Victor Ponta amânarea alegerilor prezidențiale din toamnă |work=B1.ro |date=11 August 2014 |language=Romanian}} affirming that these changes might lead to [[electoral fraud]] by favoring multiple voting.{{cite web |url=http://www.digi24.ro/Stiri/Digi24/Actualitate/Politica/Klaus+Iohannis+cere+amanarea+alegerilor+prezidentiale |title=K. Iohannis cere anularea HG care stabilește data prezidențialelor: Nu e normal ca Guvernul să creeze un avantaj pentru V. Ponta |work=Digi24 |date=11 August 2014 |language=Romanian}} In this regard, PNL brought to trial the Government.{{cite web |url=http://www.romanialibera.ro/politica/partide/iohannis--pnl-da-in-judecata-guvernul-pentru-ordonanta-care-modifica-legea-electorala-345337 |title=Iohannis: PNL dă în judecată Guvernul pentru ordonanța care modifică Legea electorală |work=România Liberă |author=Avram Eliza |date=5 August 2014 |language=Romanian}} [[Cristian Diaconescu]], then the presidential candidate of [[People's Movement Party|PMP]], notified by letter the Venice Commission about this issue.{{cite web |url=http://www.b1.ro/stiri/politica/pmp-sesizeaza-comisia-de-la-vene-ia-cu-privire-la-legea-pentru-alegerea-pre-edintelui-85897.html |title=PMP sesizează Comisia de la Veneția cu privire la legea pentru alegerea președintelui |work=B1.ro |date=28 June 2014 |language=Romanian}} In September, the candidacies of [[Victor Ponta]] and [[Monica Macovei]] were contested at the [[Constitutional Court of Romania|Constitutional Court]], but the complaints were rejected by the court.{{cite web |url=http://www.realitatea.net/candidaturile-lui-ponta-si-macovei-contestate-ccr-anunta-astazi-decizia_1531242.html |title=Candidaturile lui Ponta și Macovei, CONTESTATE. CCR le-a RESPINS |work=Realitatea.net |date=23 September 2014 |language=Romanian}} On the other hand, the National Integrity Agency (ANI) announced in April 2013 that it believed [[Klaus Iohannis]] was in a 'state of incompatibility',{{cite web |url=http://www.ziare.com/klaus-johannis/primar-sibiu/dosarul-de-incompatibilitate-al-lui-klaus-iohannis-inalta-curte-a-stabilit-termenul-de-judecata-surse-1323731 |title=Dosarul de incompatibilitate al lui Klaus Iohannis: Înalta Curte a stabilit termenul de judecată |work=Ziare.com |date=23 September 2014 |language=Romanian}} because he has been the representative of [[Sibiu]] in the General Meeting of Shareholders of SC Apă Canal SA Sibiu (since 5 August 2010) and of SC Piețe SA (since 30 April 2009), which contravenes legal provisions governing conflicts of interest.{{cite web |url=http://stirileprotv.ro/stiri/actualitate/iccj-a-stabilit-primul-termen-pentru-joi-in-dosarul-de-incompatibiliate-al-lui-klaus-iohannis.html |title=Curtea Supremă a amânat procesul lui Iohannis cu ANI pentru 30 septembrie |work=Știrile Pro TV |date=25 September 2014 |language=Romanian}} Iohannis repeatedly said that ANI's claims to that effect were mistaken.{{citation needed|date=November 2014}} Iohannis was also attacked by his rivals, especially Victor Ponta, on the topic of the provenance of his six estates. Many supporters of PSD and TV stations with some sympathies for this party stated that Iohannis bought these houses illicitly,{{cite web |url=http://www.realitatea.net/romania-tv-a-inceput-execu-ia-lui-iohannis_1458583.html |title=România TV a început "EXECUȚIA" lui Iohannis |work=Realitatea.net |date=10 June 2014 |language=Romanian}} statements which were later refuted by Iohannis. He explained that he has bought the six houses by "honest work" and that the money to purchase them originated either from his own sources – salaries, tutoring, rents - or from money received from his parents and parents-in-law or from loans from friends.{{cite web |url=http://www.gandul.info/politica/iohannis-explica-sursa-banilor-pentru-cele-sase-case-parinti-socri-meditatii-salariu-chirii-imprumuturi-13417856 |title=Iohannis explică sursa banilor pentru cele șase case: părinți, socri, meditații, salariu, chirii, împrumuturi |work=Gândul |author=Cristian Andrei |date=20 October 2014 |language=Romanian}} === Undercover officer allegations === In a worsening institutional conflict between the Presidency and the Government, outgoing President [[Traian Băsescu]] accused Prime Minister [[Victor Ponta]] of serving as an undercover intelligence officer between 1997 and 2001.{{cite web |url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2014/10/14/us-romania-politics-idUSKCN0I30UG20141014 |title=Romania president says PM was an undercover spy |work=Reuters |author=Luiza Ilie |date=14 October 2014}}{{cite web |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2014/11/01/world/europe/presidential-candidates-spy-allegations-in-romania-conjure-a-dystopian-past.html |title=Spy Allegations in a Presidential Race Conjure Romania’s Authoritarian Past |work=The New York Times |author=Andrew Higgins |date=31 October 2014}} Ponta dismissed the charge as "all lies".{{cite web |url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/romanian-president-accuses-pm-spy-26179249 |title=Romanian President Accuses PM of Being an Ex-Spy |work=ABC News |author=Alison Mutler |date=14 October 2014}} His rival [[Klaus Iohannis]] demanded an immediate clarification of the situation,{{cite web |url=http://www.hotnews.ro/stiri-politic-18302119-klaus-iohanis-despre-scandalul-ponta-ofiter-acoperit-sie-solicit-lui-victor-ponta-clarifice-fata-natiunii-situatia-domniei-sale.htm?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+hotnews%2Fyvoq+(Hotnews.ro) |title=Klaus Iohanis, despre scandalul Ponta - ofițer acoperit SIE: Îi solicit lui Victor Ponta să clarifice în fața națiunii situația domniei sale |work=HotNews.ro |author=V.M. |date=14 October 2014 |language=Romanian}} while the Minister of Justice Robert Cazanciuc labelled Băsescu's statements as "campaign statements", and the topic as "ridiculous".{{cite web |url=http://business-review.eu/featured/romanian-president-says-prime-minister-acted-as-secret-intelligence-officer-71673 |title=Romanian president says prime-minister acted as secret intelligence officer |work=Business Review |date=14 October 2014}} Espionage was already a talking point during the electoral campaign. [[Teodor Meleșcanu]], who ran the [[Foreign Intelligence Service (Romania)|Foreign Intelligence Service]], resigned in September and joined the presidential race as an independent candidate one day later. Around the same time, [[Robert Turcescu]], a popular television anchor, confessed live on air that he had been an undercover lieutenant-colonel for an espionage service and resigned his post.{{cite web |url=http://www.digi24.ro/Stiri/Digi24/Actualitate/Stiri/JURNALIST+ROBERT+TURCESCU+OFITER+SUB+ACOPERIRE |title=Jurnalistul Robert Turcescu a mărturisit că a fost ofițer acoperit. C. T. Popescu: Sunt uluit de acest delir mistic |work=Digi24 |date=21 September 2014 |language=Romanian}} Under Romanian law, outing oneself as a spy is illegal, but prosecutors did not press charges. === Alleged electoral bribe === Members of PMP and PNL expressed outrage over the announced distribution of 18 kg of food to more than 6.5 million people during the electoral campaign, in October and November.{{cite web |url=http://www.nasul.tv/2014/10/05/exploziv-licitatie-ilegala-cu-fonduri-europene-pentru-mita-electorala-mascata-in-66-milioane-pachete-cu-18-kg-de-alimente/ |title=Licitație ilegală cu fonduri europene pentru mită electorală mascată în 6,6 milioane pachete cu 18 kg de alimente |work=Nașul TV |author=Dorina Lascăr |date=5 October 2014 |language=Romanian}} In a press release, PNL stated that "in the mad rush for votes for presidential candidate Victor Ponta, PSD doesn't have the slightest reluctance to use EU funds for masked electoral bribe". This initiative was endorsed by the Ministry of European Funds, who published on 20 September a notice of auction in which the Romanian government said it wants to provide 6,652,986 food packages within the Fund of European aid for the most deprived persons.{{cite web |url=http://epochtimes-romania.com/news/iobagii-primesc-tain-electoral-plasuta-de-18-kg-de-alimente-pentru-6-5-milioane-de-defavorizati---224257 |title=Iobagii primesc tain electoral - "Plăsuța" de 18 kg de alimente pentru 6,5 milioane de "defavorizați" |work=The Epoch Times |author=Andrei Pricopie |date=6 October 2014 |language=Romanian}} More specifically, over 150,000 food packages would be sent to each county, totaling 100 million euros.{{cite web |url=http://epochtimes-romania.com/news/pmp-si-liberalii-suparati-pe-ponta-ca-a-aranjat-sa-imparta-pungi-de-18-kg-de-alimente-in-plina-campanie---224382 |title=PMP și liberalii, supărați pe Ponta că a aranjat să împartă pungi de 18 kg de alimente în plină campanie |work=The Epoch Times |author=Andrei Pricopie |date=8 October 2014 |language=Romanian}} PNL argues that the way this auction is organized raises serious questions about its legality. The Minister for European Funds, Eugen Teodorovici, said that EU funds are not used for electoral purposes and any claims of their diversion is "misinformation". President [[Traian Băsescu]] repeatedly stated that Victor Ponta "bribes the electorate" and "makes electoral alms from borrowed money".{{cite web |url=http://www.romanialibera.ro/politica/institutii/18-30-declaratii-de-presa-traian-basescu-353242 |title=Traian Băsescu: Ponta și Iohannis sunt mincinoși și corupți. Nu îl susțin nici pe Ponta și nici pe Iohannis. Susțin candidatul PMP. Toată populația României îi plătește campania lui Ponta. Nu mai vorbim despre moralitatea lui Iohannis care are un proces deschis cu ANI. Nu îi consider pe niciunul demn de a fi președinte |work=România Liberă |author=Paul Filimon |date=13 October 2014 |language=Romanian}} In a press conference critical to Victor Ponta and Klaus Iohannis, Băsescu mentioned the figure of 4.8 billion euros, money that would go towards electoral alms and will be paid by the population.{{cite web |url=http://www.mediafax.ro/politic/basescu-nu-i-sustin-si-nu-ii-voi-sustine-nici-pe-ponta-nici-pe-iohannis-la-prezidentiale-raman-consecvent-in-a-o-sustine-pe-elena-udrea-declaratiile-presedintelui-13380027 |title=Băsescu: Nu-i susțin și nu îi voi susține nici pe Ponta, nici pe Iohannis la prezidențiale. Rămân consecvent în a o susține pe Elena Udrea. DECLARAȚIILE președintelui |work=Mediafax.ro |author=Irina Tacu, Valentina Postelnicu |date=13 October 2014 |language=Romanian}} During a large meeting in [[Iași]], [[Klaus Iohannis]] mentioned that Ponta's figure is on each pole and tree, asking rhetorically where the money for his campaign came from. He also stated that every Romanian pays Ponta's campaign from the taxes and dues he introduced.{{cite web |url=http://www.realitatea.net/iohannis--de-unde-provin-banii-de-campanie-ai-lui-ponta-sunt-bani-din-taxe-si-impozite--bani-din-coruptie_1549886.html |title=Iohannis: De unde provin banii de campanie ai lui Ponta? Sunt bani din taxe și impozite, bani din corupție? |work=Realitatea.net |date=18 October 2014 |language=Romanian}} During the same meeting, Iohannis refuted all rumors regarding his intentions to cut the pensions after the election, after many pensioners received flyers in the mail, with messages such as "Only Ponta protects the pensions" and "Klaus Iohannis wants to cut your pension" written on them.{{cite web |url=http://www.ziuaconstanta.ro/stiri/politic/fluturasii-electorali-zboara-liberi-prin-judet-pensionarii-denunta-campania-denigratoare-pe-care-psd-516501.html |title=Pensionarii denunță "campania denigratoare" pe care PSD o face prin poștă |work=Ziua de Constanța |author=Nicoleta Nicolau |date=18 October 2014 |language=Romanian}} In a press release, ACL accused PSD that it engages in a campaign against Klaus Iohannis by misinforming and deceiving voters.{{cite web |url=http://www.ziare.com/alegeri/alegeri-prezidentiale-2014/psd-si-posta-romana-acuzati-ca-trimit-pensionarilor-pliante-anti-iohannis-1327822 |title=PSD și Poșta Română, acuzați că trimit pensionarilor pliante anti-Iohannis |work=Ziare.com |date=15 October 2014 |language=Romanian}} The [[Romanian Post]] signed contracts with PSD, but also with PMP, Macovei and Tăriceanu, agreeing to send newspapers, catalogs, leaflets, brochures and other electoral advertising materials to homes around the country.{{cite web |url=http://www.mediafax.ro/politic/posta-romana-sunt-contracte-si-cu-macovei-udrea-si-tariceanu-pe-distribuirea-de-material-electoral-13424402 |title=Poșta Română: Sunt contracte și cu Macovei, Udrea și Tăriceanu pe distribuirea de material electoral |work=Mediafax |date=20 October 2014 |language=Romanian}} Over 4 million anti-Iohannis flyers were distributed by the Romanian Post, totaling up to 50,000 euros.{{cite web |url=http://www.gandul.info/politica/cat-l-au-costat-pe-ponta-cei-4-milioane-de-fluturasi-anti-iohannis-impartiti-de-posta-romana-cu-talonul-de-pensie-13701926 |title=Cât l-au costat pe Ponta cei 4 milioane de fluturaşi anti-Iohannis, împărţiţi de Poşta Română cu talonul de pensie |work=Gândul |author=Cristian Andrei |date=4 December 2014 |language=Romanian}} === Vote rigging in Moldova === Sebastian Ghiță, PSD deputy and Victor Ponta's fellow, would be part of a pyramidal mechanism of defrauding the 2014 presidential election, according to prosecutors from the [[National Anticorruption Directorate]], [[Ploiești]] branch. He would have given money from illegal deals to persuade voters from [[Moldova]] to elect Ponta as president.{{cite web |url=http://www.ziare.com/sebastian-ghita/dna/dna-sebastian-ghita-a-cumparat-cu-bani-negri-alegatori-pentru-ponta-in-r-moldova-1369932 |title=DNA: Sebastian Ghita a cumparat cu bani negri alegatori pentru Ponta in R.Moldova |work=Ziare.com |date=24 June 2015 |language=Romanian}}{{cite web |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2015/06/25/world/europe/romania-from-frying-pan-to-legal-fire.html |title=Romania: From Frying Pan to Legal Fire |work=The New York Times |date=24 June 2015}} Sebastian Ghiță would hand in the PSD headquarters in [[Bucharest]] 400,000 euros to Alin Petran, an intermediary sent over the Prut to gather the necessary votes.{{cite web |url=http://www.digi24.ro/Stiri/Digi24/Actualitate/Justitie/Noi+acuzatii+pentru+Sebastian+Ghita+El+este+asteptat+la+DNA+Ploi |title=EXCLUSIV. S. Ghiță, mecanism piramidal pentru fraudă la prezidențiale. Martor: Victor Ponta era la curent |work=Digi24 |date=24 June 2015 |language=Romanian}} Subsequently, the intermediary has recruited ten coordinators who, in turn, managed 200 people. Each was responsible to provide between 50 and 100 votes to the social democrat candidate. Electors who demonstrated that voted with Victor Ponta received watches, clothes or food.{{cite web |url=http://www.gandul.info/stiri/finantarea-campaniei-victor-ponta-republica-moldova-investigata-procurori-sponsorul-sebastian-ghita-iesirea-dna-depune-plangere-procurorul-general-impotriva-oamenilor-vor-lovitura-palat-romania-14494961 |title=Finanţarea campaniei lui Victor Ponta în Republica Moldova, INVESTIGATĂ de procurori. Sponsorul Sebastian Ghiţă, la ieşirea de la DNA: „Voi depune plângere la Procurorul General împotriva oamenilor care vor o lovitură de palat în România” |work=Gândul |last1=Popescu |first=Andrei Luca |last2=Ilie |first2=Daciana |date=24 June 2015 |language=Romanian}} Total costs of these operations were estimated at 350,000 euros.{{cite web |url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/world/europe/romanian-pms-aide-indicted-for-corruption-charges/2015/06/24/99aac7aa-1a66-11e5-bed8-1093ee58dad0_story.html |title=Romanian premier’s aide indicted for corruption charges |work=The Washington Post |date=24 June 2015}}{{cite web |url=http://www.mediafax.ro/politic/sebastian-ghita-urmarit-trafic-influenta-spalare-bani-coruperea-alegatorilor-mi-interzice-parasesc-ploiestiul-probabil-umilit-interdictie-vorbi-victor-ponta-14494045 |title=Sebastian Ghiţă, urmărit pentru trafic de influenţă, spălare de bani şi coruperea alegătorilor: "Mi se interzice să părăsesc Ploieştiul, probabil pentru a fi umilit. Am interdicţie de a vorbi cu Victor Ponta" |work=Mediafax |last=Hera |first=Mona |date=24 June 2015 |language=Romanian}} Investigators also determined that Sebastian Ghiță and his friends would have created a database that included 20,000 Romanian citizens from Moldova, with voting rights in the 2014 presidential election. According to a witness, Victor Ponta was aware "about this fraudulent attempt to win the presidential election". As of 24 June 2015, Sebastian Ghiță is prosecuted for [[influence peddling]], [[money laundering]] and bribing the voters.{{cite web |url=http://stirileprotv.ro/stiri/actualitate/surse-procurorii-dna-extind-urmarirea-penala-impotriva-lui-sebastian-ghita-deputatul-este-acuzat-de-noi-fapte-de-coruptie.html |title=Cele trei masuri luate de DNA impotriva lui Sebastian Ghita. Cum ar fi corupt alegatorii cu tigai de pe piata neagra |work=Stirile Pro TV |date=24 June 2015 |language=Romanian}} Moreover, Ghiță is forbidden to exercise his function of deputy, a premiere in the Romanian justice, but also to talk with Victor Ponta or to leave Ploiești. Ghiță accuses a "prosecutors [[coup]]", in an attempt to overthrow the Ponta Government.{{cite web |url=http://stirileprotv.ro/stiri/politic/sebastian-ghita-cere-ajutorul-colegilor-din-camera-deputatilor-dupa-ce-dna-l-a-suspendat-din-parlament-este-un-abuz.html |title=Ghita anunta o "lovitura de palat a procurorilor". Imperiul PSD contraataca: ce replica pentru DNA au social-democratii |work=Stirile Pro TV |date=25 June 2015 |language=Romanian}} === Cyber attacks === In a debate organized by the PNL parliamentary group on 12 February 2015, Marcel Opriș, head of the Special Telecommunications Service (STS), stated that during the presidential election were used [[cyber attack]]s for political purposes,{{cite web |url=http://www.gandul.info/stiri/directorul-sts-la-prezidentiale-au-fost-atacuri-cibernetice-in-scop-politic-fiind-implicat-un-post-tv-13817363 |title=Directorul STS: La prezidențiale au fost atacuri cibernetice în scop politic, fiind implicat un post TV |work=Gândul |author=Andi Manciu |date=12 February 2015 |language=Romanian}} being involved a Romanian television through which a signal was given for "a devastating qualified attack for IT-ists".{{cite web |url=http://www.hotnews.ro/stiri-esential-19360717-marcel-opris-sts-atacurile-cibernetice-pot-folosite-scopuri-politice-episod-petrecut-perioada-prezidentialelor.htm |title=Marcel Opriș (STS): Atacurile cibernetice pot fi folosite în scopuri politice; un episod s-a petrecut în perioada prezidențialelor |work=HotNews.ro |author=R. M. |date=12 February 2015 |language=Romanian}} PNL deputy Mihăiță Calimente announced he'll propose at the Defence Commission of the [[Chamber of Deputies of Romania|Chamber of Deputies]] as the director of STS to be heard on this subject.{{cite web |url=http://www.cotidianul.ro/opris-un-atac-cibernetic-s-a-petrecut-in-perioada-prezidentialelor-256584/ |title=Opriș: Un atac cibernetic s-a petrecut în perioada prezidențialelor |work=Cotidianul.ro |author=Paul Dumitrescu |date=12 February 2015 |language=Romanian}} === Diaspora voting === [[File:Alegerile prezidențiale românești din 16 noiembrie 2014 la München (1).webm|thumb|Second round. The waiting line in [[Munich]], [[Germany]], before 8 a.m.|left|421x421px]] The first round of voting was marked by a scandal concerning the small number of polling stations in countries with large communities of Romanian citizens. 294 polling stations were organized in 95 states,{{cite web |url=http://www.mediafax.ro/politic/alegeri-prezidentiale-2014-in-strainatate-sunt-294-de-sectii-primii-voteaza-cei-din-noua-zeelanda-13482717 |title=ALEGERI PREZIDENȚIALE 2014: În străinătate sunt 294 de secții. Primii votează cei din Noua Zeelandă |work=Mediafax.ro |author=Cătălina Mihai |date=31 October 2014 |language=Romanian}} given that over 3 million Romanians with voting right are living and working abroad. In cities like [[London]], [[Paris]], [[Madrid]], [[Vienna]], [[Munich]], [[Stuttgart]], [[Turin]], [[Rome]] or [[Chișinău]] huge queues of voters were reported at embassies or other polling stations.{{cite web |url=http://english.hotnews.ro/stiri-top_news-18444455-romanian-voters-abroad-humiliated-government-organisers-forced-them-wait-for-hours-long-queues-european-cities-presidential-poll.htm |title=Romanian voters abroad humiliated: government organisers forced them to wait for hours in long queues in European cities in presidential poll |work=HotNews.ro |author=V.O. |date=3 November 2014}}{{cite web |url=http://www.romania-insider.com/chaos-at-romanias-voting-polls-abroad-long-queues-protests/134937/ |title=Chaos at Romania’s voting polls abroad: long queues, protests |work=Romania-Insider.com |date=3 November 2014}} They claim they were prevented from exercising their right to vote, inasmuch as thousands of voters were locked outside the embassies and could not vote until the polls closed.{{cite web |url=http://www.standard.co.uk/news/london/thousands-of-romanians-locked-outside-london-embassy-denied-their-right-to-vote-9834568.html |title=Hundreds of Romanians locked outside London Embassy 'denied their right to vote' |work=London Evening Standard |author=Anna Dubuis |date=3 November 2014}} Presidential candidates [[Klaus Iohannis]], [[Elena Udrea]] and [[Monica Macovei]] urged the prolongation of the voting process in these countries.{{cite web |url=https://ro.stiri.yahoo.com/monica-macovei-cere-prelungirea-programului-%C3%AEn-sec%C5%A3iile-votare-164818263.html |title=Alegeri prezidențiale 2014. Monica Macovei cere prelungirea programului în secțiile de votare din străinătate și a depus mai multe contestații |work=Yahoo! News |date=2 November 2014 |language=Romanian}}{{cite web |url=http://www.romanialibera.ro/politica/politica-alegeri-prezidentiale/iohannis-a-denuntat-proasta-organizare-a-alegerilor-in-tara-si-diaspora--a-cerut-bec-prelungirea-votarii-355748 |title=Klaus Iohannis a denunțat PROASTA ORGANIZARE a alegerilor în țară și diaspora. A cerut BEC prelungirea votării |work=România Liberă |author=Paul Filimon |date=2 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} Moreover, the Presidential Administration demanded in a release the immediate resignation of Foreign Minister [[Titus Corlățean]] and Minister Delegate for Romanians Abroad Bogdan Stanoevici for poor organization of election in diaspora.{{cite web |url=http://www.realitatea.net/traian-basescu-cere-demisia-mini-trilor-corla-ean-i-stanoevici_1561027.html |title=TRAIAN BĂSESCU cere DEMISIA miniștrilor CORLĂȚEAN și STANOEVICI |work=Realitatea.net |date=2 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} Likewise, independent candidate [[Gheorghe Funar]] submitted an application to the President of BEC, demanding the cancellation of the first round of voting and its resumption because he considers that the equality of citizens before the law was not ensured, and the right to vote of Romanians abroad was seriously violated.{{cite web |url=http://www.agerpres.ro/politica/2014/11/02/funar-cere-anularea-si-reluarea-primului-tur-al-alegerilor-prezidentiale-20-52-19 |title=Funar cere anularea și reluarea primului tur al alegerilor prezidențiale |work=Agerpres |date=2 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} These problems determined [[Gunther Krichbaum]], the chairman of the Commission for European Affairs in the Bundestag to declare that the issue at stake does not concern "possible difficulties in the organisation of elections, but a wilful hinderance of the free expression of the votes", based on the current leftist government's knowledge of the fact that "Romanians living abroad have the tendency to vote with the parties and candidates of the centre-right".{{Citation | url=http://actmedia.eu/daily/the-chairman-of-the-commission-for-european-affairs-in-bundestag-writes-to-juncker-the-sections-outside-romania-received-indications-from-bucharest-to-hinder-the-vote/54970| title=The chairman of the Commission for European Affairs in Bundestag writes to Juncker: the sections outside Romania received indications from Bucharest to hinder the vote| newspaper=Actmedia.eu/daily/the-chairman-of-the-commission-for-european-affairs-in-bundestag-writes-to-juncker-the-sections-outside-romania-received-indications-from-bucharest-to-hinder-the-vote/54970| date= | author=| accessdate=29 November 2014}} Irregularities were also reported in the country's major university centers, where students were forced to form queues of hundreds of people or were redirected to other polling stations, as the standardized affidavit forms had run out.{{cite web |url=http://www.gandul.info/reportaj/apelul-studentilor-din-regie-care-nu-au-putut-vota-vrem-sa-votam-asta-e-democratia-lui-ponta-13486137 |title=Apelul studenților din Regie care nu au putut vota: "Vrem să votăm! Asta e democrația lui Ponta?" |work=Gândul |author=Andreea Ofițeru |date=3 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} Angry voters staged spontaneous protests in front of the polling stations in [[Paris]], [[Vienna]], [[London]], [[Madrid]], [[New York City]], [[Strasbourg]] and many other locations, chanting slogans like "Down with Ponta!", "Plagiarized vote" or "We want to vote".{{cite web |url=http://www.gandul.info/stiri/alegeri-prezidentiale-2014-mii-de-romani-au-protestat-la-londra-scandand-jos-ponta-vot-plagiat-si-vrem-sa-votam-13485988 |title=ALEGERI PREZIDENȚIALE 2014. Mii de români au protestat la Londra, scandând "Jos Ponta!", "Vot plagiat" și "Vrem să votăm" |work=Gândul |author=Clarice Dinu |date=2 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} In [[Paris]], [[Vienna]], [[London]] and [[Turin]] protests escalated in storming embassies and consulates. Spirits were calmed only after the intervention of law enforcement.{{cite web |url=http://www.ziare.com/alegeri/alegeri-prezidentiale-2014/romanii-au-fortat-votul-dupa-inchiderea-urnelor-la-paris-viena-si-londra-jandarmii-au-intervenit-1331006 |title=Românii au forțat votul după închiderea urnelor la Paris, Viena și Londra - jandarmii au intervenit |work=Ziare.com |author=Irina Olteanu, Cristian Soitu |date=3 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} Under pressure from street protests that followed the first round, Titus Corlățean resigned on 10 November.{{cite web |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/reuters/article-2828389/Romanian-foreign-minister-resigns-election-row.html |title=Romanian foreign minister resigns in election row |work=Daily Mail |author=Radu-Sorin Marinaș |date=10 November 2014}} Prime Minister Victor Ponta proposed former presidential candidate [[Teodor Meleșcanu]] to occupy this position. The same day, Meleșcanu took the oath in front of President Traian Băsescu at the [[Cotroceni Palace]].{{cite web |url=http://www.mediafax.ro/politic/teodor-melescanu-a-depus-juramantul-de-investitura-in-functia-de-ministru-de-externe-basescu-demisia-lui-corlatean-a-intervenit-prea-tarziu-il-numesc-pe-melescanu-datorita-urgentei-13523461 |title=Teodor Meleșcanu a depus jurământul de învestitură în funcția de ministru de Externe. Băsescu: Demisia lui Corlățean a intervenit prea târziu. Îl numesc pe Meleșcanu "datorită urgenței" |work=Mediafax.ro |date=10 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} Despite measures taken by new Minister of Foreign Affairs, the scandal in the first round repeated in the second one, but in higher proportions. Kilometer-long queues were reported in several European cities, including [[Paris]], [[Strasbourg]], [[London]], [[Dublin]], [[Brussels]], [[Oslo]], [[Bonn]], [[Munich]], [[Stuttgart]], [[Turin]], [[Rome]] and [[Madrid]].{{cite web |url=http://www.gandul.info/stiri/fiti-eroi-turul-doi-statul-isi-bate-joc-azi-romanii-strainatate-imagini-cozile-umilintei-update-campania-psd-acuza-presa-induce-sentimentul-e-organizat-corect-votul-sectii-goale-13566444 |title="FIȚI EROI ÎN TURUL DOI!". Statul își bate joc și azi de românii din străinătate. Imagini cu cozile umilinței. UPDATE: Campania PSD acuză presa că induce "sentimentul că nu e organizat corect votul": "Sunt secții goale!" |work=Gândul |author=Alina Matis |date=16 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} Once more, ACL and [[Monica Macovei]] urged the prolongation of voting process.{{cite web |url=http://www.hotnews.ro/stiri-esential-18573815-acl-cere-biroului-electora-central-prelungirea-programului-votare-strainatate.htm |title=ACL cere Biroului Electoral Central prelungirea programului de votare în străinătate |work=HotNews.ro |author=I.C. |date=16 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} Spontaneous protests broke out again in front of embassies and consulates in major European cities. Protesters expressed anger over Ponta's government and poor organization of the election.{{cite web |url=http://www.ziare.com/alegeri/alegeri-prezidentiale-2014/diaspora-voteaza-cozi-uriase-proteste-si-imnul-national-live-1333580 |title=Diaspora votează: Circa 10.000 de români, la coadă în Londra |work=Ziare.com |author=Diana Toea |date=16 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} Shortly after the polls closed, angry voters forced the entrances into the embassies and consulates, to be able to exercise their right to vote. In [[Paris]] and [[Turin]], things degenerated into street fighting between voters and law enforcement.{{cite web |url=http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2014-11-16/romanian-presidential-race-too-close-to-call-exit-polls-show.html |title=Johannis Wins Romania Presidency in Double-Digit Comeback |work=Bloomberg |author=Andra Timu, Edith Balazs |date=16 November 2014}} Displeased voters were dispersed by police with [[tear gas]] and batons.{{cite web |url=http://www.reddit.com/r/europe/comments/2mhv4a/italian_and_french_police_evict_romanian_voters/ |title=Italian and French police evict Romanian voters from Romanian embassies using tear gas |work=Reddit |date=16 November 2014}} Four people were injured and one arrested after the intervention of [[Carabinieri]] in [[Turin]].{{cite web |url=http://www.b1.ro/stiri/externe/patru-rani-i-i-un-roman-arestat-la-torino-dupa-interven-ia-poli-i-tilor-la-o-sec-ie-de-votare-foto-96113.html |title=Efectul organizării alegerilor în diaspora: Patru răniți și un român arestat la Torino, după intervenția polițiștilor la o secție de votare |work=B1.ro |date=17 November 2014 |language=Romanian}} Having followed the election process, the chairman of the Commission for European Affairs in Bundestag, Gunther Krichbaum, suggested that the voting rights of Romanian citizens had been hindered to such an extent, that the Diaspora voting problems should be investigated as "fraud", and that [[Victor Ponta]] should withdraw from office, having lost all authority to serve the public, in any position or qualification.{{Citation | url=http://www.ziare.com/victor-ponta/premier/inalt-oficial-de-la-berlin-ponta-nu-mai-este-calificat-pentru-nicio-responsabilitate-in-stat-1334600| title=Inalt oficial de la Berlin: Ponta nu mai este calificat pentru nicio responsabilitate in stat| newspaper=Ziare.com| date= 21 November 2014| author=Ioana Ene Dogioiu| accessdate=29 November 2014}}{{Citation | url=http://www.gunther-krichbaum.de/| title=Home| newspaper=Gunther-krichbaum.de/| date= | author= Official Blog, para. 4| accessdate=29 November 2014}} == References == {{Reflist|30em}} == External links == {{commonscat-inline|Romanian presidential elections, 2014}} {{Romanian presidential elections}} {{Romanian elections}} {{Victor Ponta}} {{Klaus Iohannis}} [[Category:2014 elections in Europe|Romanian presidential election, 2014]] [[Category:2014 in Romania|Presidential election]] [[Category:Presidential elections in Romania|Presidential election, 2014]] [[Category:Articles containing video clips]]
